Trial_Design.evidence: A sample size of 30 patients was calculated to test postoperative complication rates against predefined cut-offs.

Participants.evidence: patients with sporadic, resectable or potentially resectable NF-PanNETs at high-risk of recurrence; those with positive 68 Ga-labelled DOTA PET were eligible.

Intervention.evidence: All patients were candidates for neoadjuvant 177 Lu-DOTATATE followed by surgery.

Objective.evidence: The primary aim of this study was to evaluate the safety of neoadjuvant 177 Lu-labelled DOTA 0 -octreotate ( 177 Lu-DOTATATE) followed by surgery in patients with NF-PanNETs.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was safety, reflected by postoperative morbidity and mortality within 90 days.

Number_Randomised.evidence: From March 2020 to February 2023, 31 patients were enrolled

Result_Outcome.evidence: A partial radiological response was observed in 18 of 31 patients, and 13 patients had stable disease.

Harms.evidence: Postoperative complications occurred in 21 of 29 patients. Severe complications were observed in seven patients.
